newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER SHOWCASE-GULLIT SAYS DISCONTENT WILL SPUR CHELSEA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER SHOWCASE-GULLIT SAYS DISCONTENT WILL SPUR CHELSEA.

text.p: Dutch master Ruud Gullit said on Friday discontent in his Chelsea ranks would help the beat Wimbledon in Sunday's F.A. Cup semifinal.
"Sometimes it is good to have confrontation before important matches and that is my way of doing things," Gullit said.
"I did it with the Dutch national team and so did Johan Cruyff. Angry players often perform better, I know I did when I was criticised in Italy.

"You want a reaction and I saw that in training today," Gullit said after Chelsea's last practice session before the most important match of their season. "The players were really focused on the game which gives me great confidence."
Gullit has openly criticised his players in recent weeks after watching Chelsea crash to three consecutive league defeats.
On Wednesday night the players took over in the slanging match, blaming each other for conceding three second-half goals in 10 minutes in their 3-1 defeat at struggling Coventry.
Gullit also launched a verbal attack on Gianluca Vialli, who has been consigned to the bench for most of the season.
But on Friday he said he had spoken to the Italian, who assured his coach he wanted to stay at Stamford Bridge.
"We spoke for about 10 minutes and said what we wanted to," Gullit said. "He was hurt but that's what I expected...he loves it here and wants to stay which is good news for me as a coach."
